intro: Dorstenia nummularia, commonly known as the dollar plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble small shields. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often grown as a houseplant due to its ornamental foliage. Dorstenia nummularia is relatively easy to care for, requiring well-draining soil and moderate watering.
